Dear Megan Zambiasi:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-899-6024.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 put Youth A in a headlock and held her by her braids after
youth fell to the floor. Two staff pulled Staff 1 off of Youth A.
Youth A did not sustain any injuries.
Investigation Video
Video shows Youth A throwing chairs at the wall. Staff 1 and
Team Leader initiate a two-person control hold with Team Leader
on her right side and Staff 1 on her left. The staffs’ upper bodies
are in position, but neither are able to gain sufficient leverage of
the youth’s lower extremities. Youth A raises her left knee to her
chin and stomps it down in front of Staff 1 sliding her out of
position. Both staff lose hold of the youth’s shoulders. Youth A
raises her right leg to her chin and maneuvers both staff out of
position. Youth A is now in front with both staff. She kicks
backward at Team Leader and Team Leader moves away to avoid
the blow. Staff 1 raises her left knee to block a kick from Youth A,
loses her balance and is left holding just a wrist. Youth A gets her
wrist free and swats at Staff 1’s arm. Staff 1 pivots, grabs Youth
A’s braids from behind and head locks her. Youth A places her
arms under Staff 1’s right upper thigh and pulls herself and Staff 1
to the floor. Staff 1 still has ahold of the youth’s braids. Staff 2
moves in from behind and helps Staff 1 up from the floor. Then
she pulls Staff 1’s arms up and behind her back and separates
Staff 1 from Youth A.
Interviews
The Complainant was listed as an anonymous staff member.
However, upon interview Team Leader identified herself as
Complainant.
2

I notified Youth A’s Foster Care Worker of the investigation, and
she expressed no additional concerns.
I interviewed Youth A jointly with Government Worker 1 on
2/23/24. She has been at the facility for five months and has been
restrained three or four times since admission. On 2/22/24, Youth
A said “They (staff) tried to restrain me but couldn’t. I slipped out.”
As group was ending, she said Staff 1 asked her to sweep the
floor. “I couldn’t (sweep) because everybody’s stuff was on the
floor. Staff 1 said ‘I don’t give a fuck’ so I started sweeping
everybody’s stuff. Staff 1 said ‘I don’t give a fuck at this point.’ I
flipped a table and threw a broom and chair at the wall. Staff 1
and Team Leader grabbed my waist and tried to restrain me. I
popped Team Leader’s hand (demonstrating a flicking motion
using her thumb and middle finger). Staff 1 said I tried to fight her
and pulled my hair. (At the time, Youth A was wearing shoulder-
length braids) I kicked her. Her phone fell. She swung at me.
Staff 2 tried to stop Staff 1 from coming after me and her phone…I
slipped. I was sitting on the floor.”
After the incident, Youth A said her face was red and she had a
“tiny scratch” above her left eye that was no longer visible. Prior to
this incident Youth A said she and Staff 1 had a decent
relationship.
I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government Worker 1 and Rights
Officer present on 2/27/24. She has worked at the facility for less
than six months and was last trained in CPI in August 2023.
Government Worker 1 read the allegation aloud to Staff 1.
Staff 1 recalled on 2/22/24 it was time for chores and “nobody
moved.” She said she asked Youth A to start her assigned chore
and Youth A asked “How the fuck you think I’m gonna clean up
with everybody’s shit here? How ‘bout I just sweep it all?” Staff 1
admitted she told Youth A to do whatever she needed to do so
Youth A swept the girls’ items into a pile. “One youth got mad and
asked why I didn’t stop Youth A from doing that.”
Staff 1 continued. “Youth A is known to flip out. She screamed
‘Shut the fuck up’ and flipped a table toward me, picked up chairs
and flipped a table again. Team Leader and Supervisor were
there, not doing anything. Team Leader grabbed Youth A’s right
arm to restrain her. Youth A said, ‘Don’t fucking restrain me’ and
looked like she was about to hit Team Leader.” Staff 1 stated that
she and Youth A “are close.” “I was trying to do a proper hold. I
held an arm and she kicked backward at me. I put my leg in front
3

of her leg. I did not have her in a headlock. I can’t remember
what everybody else was doing. I let her go. She fell. I tripped
over her. Staff 2 was there. Nobody was helping. I fell and hurt
my wrist. I saw my phone and reached for it. Other staff pulled on
me. I wanted them to stop touching me. I got my phone…Youth
A had long braids. I don’t remember pulling her braids. Afterward
I told Supervisor that I pretty much had her in a headlock. Youth
A tore my observation sheets and clipboard. She took my jacket
and threw it in the shower and smiled.”
Staff 1 did not remember cussing at Youth A but said it is possible
she did. She admitted “I made a mistake.” It had been six months
since Staff 1 was trained in physical management, and she had
not used or practiced the holds since orientation training. Staff 1
suggested Vista Maria staff be retrained in CPI on a monthly
basis.
I interviewed Staff 2 jointly with Government Worker 1 and Rights
Officer present. It was her second week on the job when Youth A
threatened to “go fucking off!” She said Youth A lipped a table,
tossed chairs and put holes in the walls with a broom. “Staff 1 and
Team Leader restrained her on each side backed up against the
wall. Youth A was kicking at Team Leader. Staff 1 was not able
to get positioned from the waist down. Youth A fell and Staff 1 fell
with her. I picked Staff 1 up and noticed she had a handful of
Youth A’s braids. Me and Team Leader told Staff 1 to let go twice.
I had to pull both Staff 1’s arms behind her and pull her up and
back from Youth A.”
Staff 2 said she did not see Staff 1 first grab Youth A’s hair but
“she had a tight grip.” “We convinced Staff 1 to let go of her hair.
After I pulled Staff 1 off, she asked to get her phone and Team
Leader handed it to her.”
I interviewed Team Leader jointly with Government Worker 1 and
Rights Officer present. She has worked at Vista Maria for six
weeks but has 23 years of experience working in child caring
institutions. Team Leader recalled hearing screaming and seeing
Youth A throwing chairs and tables, hitting the wall. Youth A said
“The bitch (directing her anger toward Staff 1) asked me to sweep
the floor. I’ll sweep alright.” Team Leader indicated Youth A was
throwing items creating an unsafe environment. “We utilized the
two-person (control hold). Staff 1 on the left and me on the right. I
looked over and saw Staff 1 had Youth A in a headlock. I told
Staff 1 to reposition herself. “You cannot hold her like that.” Staff
1 and Youth A fell to the floor. I disengaged. Me and Staff 2
4

noticed Staff 1 had Youth A’s hair wrapped around her hand. I
directed Staff 1 to let go. She wouldn’t. Staff 2 pulled Staff 1 off.
We had Staff 1 go off the wing…”
Team Leader said Nurse told her she overheard Staff 1 in the hall
say she had Youth A in a headlock. “Youth A refused medical
care and told Nurse she was not injured. She refused a body
chart and debriefing as well. I wrote an incident report and called
CPS. Staff 1 did swear at Youth A, but I can’t recall exactly what
she said.”
I interviewed Youth M jointly with Government Worker 1. She said
Youth A “gets mad easily” and was “flipping out.” She made holes
in the wall with a broomstick and picked up a table. “Staff 1 and
Team Leader had to restrain her. Youth A was struggling. They
fell. Staff 1’s phone fell…That was just their (the staffs’)
job…Youth A did say to stop grabbing her hair while they were on
the floor…Youth A is perfectly fine. Staff 1 left I guess and hasn’t
returned.” Asked about how Staff 1 and Youth A related together,
Youth M said, “Their relationship was fine literally an hour before
that,” adding that Staff 1 was “mom” to Youth A and other youths.
Asked why youths refer to Staff 1 as “mom,” she said “A lot of us
call her that. A lot of kids have nowhere to go. Youth get comfy
with staff and peers.”
Documents Reviewed
An incident report dated 2/22/24 by Team Leader indicated Team
Leader heard commotion on blue wing. Upon entering, Youth A
was yelling and had already flipped over a table and thrown
chairs. Team Leader started moving items off of the wing. A
“clear the area” was called. Youth A continued throwing chairs at
the walls creating an unsafe environment. Team Leader and Staff
1 placed Youth A in a CPI two-person control hold. Youth A fell to
the floor and Team Leader released her. Nurse was on the unit
when this took place and offered medical attention. Youth A
refused medical attention and stated she was not injured.
Her employee record indicates Staff 1 was placed on
administrative leave on 2/23/24 and terminated on 3/6/24.
Government Worker 1 deemed Staff 1 unsuitable to work with
children.
Analysis Video shows Staff 1 grabbed and held Youth A’s braids and had
her in a headlock briefly before they both fell to the floor. Staff 2
pulled Staff 1 off of the youth.
5

CONSULTATION
Staff should maintain appropriate boundaries with the youths and
discourage them from referring to any staff members as “mom.”
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024C0001153SI intake 2/15/24; CAP pending
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
